intro: Acrostichum barbarum, commonly known as the giant reed, is a tall, perennial grass native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It has long, narrow leaves that can grow up to 3 meters in height, forming dense stands in shallow water or moist soil. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread rapidly, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. However, it is also considered invasive in some regions, outcompeting native vegetation.
